messages.subject: Skylark & Liberation (was late nights and worries)
messages.msgSnippet: I ve read three chapters and am eager to get to the rest!  (And The Skylark Sings With Me). Am currently reading The Teenage Liberation Handbook and loving it!
messages.messageBody:
I've read three chapters and am eager to get to the rest! (And The
Skylark Sings With Me).

Am currently reading The Teenage Liberation Handbook and loving it! My
kids are 6 & 4, but this book is so reassuring about UNschooling and
LIVING and trusting your kids. I'm so grateful to those who've paved the
way of HS before me. Because of them, I got to learn about HS before my
kids were school age. I'm glad that my kids are living life now, rather
than putting in their twelve years (or more) first.

I love that bedtime doesn't have to be forced. The other night (about
9pm), Dd handed me a piece of paper that she'd marked 4 grids on. I was
"assigned" to draw a picture of my 4 favorite things from that day and
write a paragraph about each one. (She'd left a tiny space for each of
my paragraphs!) LOL! I told her I couldn't get to it right then, but
would later. She reappeared about 30 minutes later and had done the
assignment for me!
We haven't done "school" except for a few months (sort of) at the
beginning of kindergarten last year, so I'm not sure where this all came
from.

Gotta go fix "lunch" now for 4 yr old (it's 9am here).
Mary Ellen

>>You're welcome! (then, -- and this is NOT an ad -- you'll love my
book)
> David>>
